snippet: President Obama took aim at Mitt Romney’s corporate tax proposals, while Mr. Romney accused Mr. Obama of “crony capitalism.”
abstract: Pres Obama and Mitt Romney escalate attacks against each other over issues relating to capitalism, integrity and the economy; Obama takes aim at Mitt Romney’s corporate tax proposals, citing study that shows that jobs created under his plan would only exist overseas; Romney counters by disputing research and accusing Obama of crony capitalism by using government resources to reward donors.

byline.original: By PETER BAKER and MICHAEL D. SHEAR
byline.contributor: Peter Baker reported from Cincinnati, and Michael D. Shear from Washington. Trip Gabriel contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: President Obama took aim at Mitt Romney’s corporate tax proposals, while Mr. Romney accused Mr. Obama of “crony capitalism.”

headline.seo: Obama and Romney Step Up Accusations on Jobs
headline.main: Obama and Romney Step Up Accusations on Jobs
headline.print_headline: Obama and Romney Step Up Accusations on Jobs
